item.description: People who can no longer move or speak may soon have a new option: an implanted device that links their brain to a computer.

item.title: This company wants to be the first to mine the ocean floor, with Trump's help
item.description: The Metals Company is applying for permission from the Trump administration to mine for nickel and cobalt beneath a remote patch of the Pacific Ocean. Other countries say the minerals aren't America's to mine.

item.title: In effort to protect children, France bans smoking at parks and beaches
item.description: Smokers are no longer allowed to light up in public parks, at swimming pools, or at beaches, or "anywhere children may be present," said French health and family minister Catherine Vautrin.

item.title: Murders are down nationwide. Researchers point to a key reason
item.description: Homicides are falling dramatically in many U.S. cities, after a surge in 2020 and 2021. Analysts say a reinvestment in communities from local government after the pandemic's disruption is a key reason.

item.title: Decades later, Karen de Boer still remembers a kind gesture from her college hallmate
item.description: As a college freshman, Karen de Boer was sometimes inconsiderate to her hallmate, Pam. So when Karen missed the bus to her choir performance, she was surprised — and moved — when Pam came to her rescue.

item.title: The best support for a friend with cancer? Presence, listening and space to vent
item.description: People who get cancer say their friends often disappear when they hear the bad news. Don't be that person! Here's advice for what to do and say — and what not to say — when a loved one faces cancer.

item.title: DOJ announces plans to prioritize cases to revoke citizenship
item.description: Denaturalization is a tactic heavily used during the McCarthy era and one that was expanded during the Obama administration and grew further during President Trump's first term. It's a tool usually used in only the most serious and rare of cases: dealing with Nazis or war criminals.

item.title: 80 years later, a Holocaust survivor meets an American soldier who helped free him
item.description: Andrew Roth survived the Nazi concentration camp Buchenwald. Jack Moran helped liberate the camp while serving in the U.S. Army. Decades after liberation, the two met and shared their stories.

item.title: Canadian prime minister says U.S. trade talks resume after Canada rescinded tech tax
item.description: President Trump said Friday that he was suspending trade talks with Canada over its plans to continue with its tax on technology firms, which he called "a direct and blatant attack on our country."
